page.title: 13Netherthorpe Airfield.
page.content: {Netherthorpe}is the smallest{airfield in the U.K. with runways of only 380m and 480m. It has been an airfield since the First World War and during the Second War was used for training agents for espionage and special missions. The airfield is now the centre for{Sheffield Aero Club}with 380 members, open every day except Christmas Day and New Years Day. There are 38{light aircraft}based here with 3 hangers used as workshops and stores. The aircraft cost around Â£35,000 each, using 3 gallons of fuel per hour, and the club pays Â£3,000 per year in rental to the landowners. The club offers some of the cheapest flying lessons in the country with flying instruction at Â£41 an hour. There is no age limit for learners but most are over 16, and 17 is the minimum age for solo flying.
